text: Philipp Huber (born 18 February 1974) is a Swiss decathlete. His personal best result was 8153 points, achieved in June 2000 in Götzis. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1992 |World Junior Championships |Seoul, South Korea |5th |Decathlon |7188 pts |- |1994 |European Championships |Helsinki, Finland |14th |Decathlon |7725 pts |- |1995 |Hypo-Meeting |Götzis, Austria |24th |Decathlon |7591 pts |- |rowspan=2|1997 |Hypo-Meeting |Götzis, Austria |9th |Decathlon |8017 pts |- |World Championships |Athens, Greece | 12th |Decathlon |8107 pts |- |rowspan=3|1998 |Hypo-Meeting |Götzis, Austria |11th |Decathlon |8051 pts |- |European Championships |Budapest, Hungary |12th |Decathlon |8081 pts |- |IAAF World Combined Events Challenge |several places |11th |Decathlon |24,063 pts |- |rowspan=2|2000 |Hypo-Meeting |Götzis, Austria |10th |Decathlon |8153 pts |- |Olympic Games |Sydney, Australia | — |Decathlon |DNF |- |2004 |Hypo-Meeting |Götzis, Austria |14th |Decathlon |7895 pts |} ==External links== * Category:1974 births Category:Living people Category:Swiss decathletes Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2000 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Switzerland
title: Philipp Huber
